data.title: Allow explicit TextField focus traversal.
data.body: For when you have separate columns of text fields, or a group that wants to capture traversal and loop around.

data.title: Always respect explicit row() calls (obsolete)
data.body: If the user calls `row()` it can be assumed the user definitely wants a new row. #4183 describes a case where this is needed.

data.title: LwjglCanvas disposes listener before OpenGL context get killed
data.body:
This commit fixes libgdx/libgdx#4203

Please, check `LwjglCanvasTest.java` with `setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.DISPOSE_ON_CLOSE)` and see that it's now working correct.

data.title: Add respect-min-size functionality to SplitPane
data.body:
I've been using this in my project for a while and it has saved me a lot of time. This lets you set the SplitPane to respect the min size of the widgets in it, so the handle cannot shrink either inner widget to the point of cropping it. This is a lot easier than trying to manually calculate the split amount limits and also allows it to layout properly when you want this functionality.

I considered using prefSizes instead, but I think going down that path would make it ambiguous in usage. What I mean is, SplitPane crops widgets that are drawn smaller than their min sizes, so that's what we want to prevent. You can wrap it in a container if it doesn't already have a min size, or you want to use the pref size as a min size. Since the inner widgets are often Tables, this is usually not a concern anyway.

As far as I know, the only place where this might modify existing projects is where I started counting the min size of the handle drawable in the `getMinWidth` and `getMinHeight` methods. I think this is more technically correct since you shouldn't be able to draw a split pane so small that you can't see the handle.

data.title: Pixmap default scaling filter and blend mode inconsistency
data.body:
#### Issue details

Pixmap scaling filter is initialized to linear and blend mode to source over in [Gdx2DPixmap.java](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/1.9.3/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/graphics/g2d/Gdx2DPixmap.java#L84-L85), but [gdx2d.c
](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/1.9.3/gdx/jni/gdx2d/gdx2d.c#L20-L21) initializes scaling filter to nearest and blend mode to none.
They should be initialized to same default value.
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

checked on 1.9.3
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x] core
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.title: Allow custom window icons in Lwjgl3
data.body: This is an alternative to #4177. I fixed some bugs it had, simplified usage, and added the ability to set icons in the window configuration, so different windows can have different icons.

data.title: Allow custom window icons in Lwjgl3 (obsolete)
data.body: See 4213 instead.

data.title: Fix for editor panel being hidden behind image panel
data.body: Simple fix for #4210. Repositions the emitter panel to the top so that it isn't hidden on any platform.

data.title: Particle editor renderer blocks emitters panel on retina mac devices.
data.body:
#### Issue details

On retina mac devices (and perhaps some others), the particle rendering panel in the particle editor is placed on top of the emitters panel in the bottom left.

**Image of problem:**
http://pasteboard.co/2WXVrT3Qw.png
#### Reproduction steps/code

Run the particle editor on a retina mac device.
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

Current version 1.9.4
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [x] MacOS

data.title: CheckBoxStyle copy constructor is broken
data.body:
#### Issue details

On contrary to `TextButtonStyle`, `CheckBoxStyle` copy constructor does not call `super(style)`, which leads to many properties being omitted.

Side note: when fixing this bug, one should also remove unnecessarily copies of some properties from super class:

``` Java
            this.font = style.font;
            this.fontColor = new Color(style.fontColor); 
```

These are already copied by the super constructor in a safer way (`fontColor` might be null).
#### Reproduction steps/code

Create a new `CheckBoxStyle`, set some properties from super classes (like `pressedOffsetX`), try to create a new `CheckBoxStyle` with the previous one passed into the constructor. Some properties will not be copied.
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

1.9.3.
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x] Android
- [x] iOS (robovm)
- [x] iOS (MOE)
- [x] HTML/GWT
- [x] Windows
- [x] Linux
- [x] MacOS

data.title: Wrong display size on IOS
data.body:
Please ensure you have given all the following requested information in your report.
#### Issue details

On IOS application (RoboVM) I get wrong display size. For example, on IPhone 6 and 5s (OS 9.3) get w=640.0 h=960.0.
But, the other project with same info.plist.xml and robovm.xml work fine.
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

1.9.3
#### Stacktrace

``` java
[debug] IOSApplication: iOS version: 9.3
[debug] IOSApplication: Running in 64-bit mode
[debug] IOSApplication: scale: 2.0
[debug] IOSApplication: Status bar is not visible
[debug] IOSApplication: Total computed bounds are w=640.0 h=960.0
[debug] IOSGraphics: Display: ppi=264, density=1.65
[debug] IOSApplication: created
[debug] IOSApplication: resumed
[debug] IOSApplication: Status bar is not visible
[debug] IOSApplication: Total computed bounds are w=640.0 h=960.0

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [*] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS
```

data.title: Preferences doesn't support storing or fetching double's
data.body:
#### Issue details

Is there any reason that the preferences interface doesn't support double's? (or opposition to adding support for them?)

I might get time to put in a PR for this in a couple of weeks if there is no opposition, but if someone else wants to do it thats fine by me! (I still have to sort out CLA/checkout the source etc)

data.title: Multiple Texture Atlases in Skin constructor
New projects don't correctly build when using the gradle task gwtDev.
data.body:
#### Issue details

New projects don't correctly run gwtDev mode from command line with gradle.
#### Reproduction steps/code
1. Create a new project with sub-projects of Desktop and Html.
2. `cd` to the new project folder and run `gradle gwtDev`.
3. gwtDev is unable to resolve the `*.gwt.xml` in the core project.

A repo demoing this bug is available here: https://github.com/juckele/broken-gwt
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

1.9.3
#### Stacktrace

N/A
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [X] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.title: Change gl handle to webgl object hash maps to an efficient jso int map
data.body: Change gl handle to webgl object hash maps to an efficient jso int mapp (based on sparse js arrays) tailored towards this purpose. Remove unneeded helpers

data.title: LwjglCanvas#stop() releases OpenGL context before ApplicationListener#dispose() called
Hiero creates fnt file without any space delimiting the fields for higher Unicode blocks
data.body:
#### Issue details

Hiero creates a file where for Unicode characters with high codepoints there's no space delimiting the `ìd` and `x` attribute.  This results in `BitmapFont` not being able to parse the file (results in a `NumberFormatException`).
#### Reproduction steps/code
1. Start Hiero
2. Insert `😀` into the example text field
3. Select font that supports this character (e.g. DejaVu Sans)
4. Export file
5. Load or open file, see that there's no space
6. Search for "128512"

`char id=128512x=704  y=0    width=19   height=19   xoffset=-1   yoffset=-1   xadvance=18   page=0    chnl=0`
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

1.9.4-SNAPSHOT
#### Please select the affected platforms

Ubuntu 16.04, very likely all platforms Hiero runs on
#### Quickfix

add spaces between `id=128512` and `x=704`.

data.title: BitmapFont can't load files with spaces in the name
Master
Color.rgb888ToColor erroneously treats incoming color as ARGB instead of RGB.
iOS app generated from basic setup, createIPA should be submittable
data.body:
#### Issue details

Use LibGDX setup tool to generate a basic iOS app. Attempting to submit to app store fails due to several missing requirements. We should probably start new developers off on the right foot by having the minimum requirements in the generated iOS app, so they can start developing instead of troubleshooting the setup. I'll make a PR to improve this if I have time, just documenting the idea right now.
#### Reproduction steps/code
- Download libgdx setup app
- Create basic ios project
- Build with gradle task createIPA
- Attempt to submit to app store

Upload fails:
- Missing 64 bit support
- No minimum iOS version set
- Error about multitasking config
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

1.93
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [X] iOS (robovm)

data.body:
in android multi touch, sometimes a new pointer-down event of
one pointer id come without corresponding pointer-up,
and when action_cancel event comes, all the previous pointer ids should be invalidated
